cards.title: Picture of the day / Mountain biking in Baku

item.title: Sport picture of the day: mountain biking in Baku
item.trailText: Before the 2015 European Games, some athletes check out the course during a training session at the Mountain Bike Velopark in Baku, Azerbaijan

cards.title: Sport picture of the day / The long shadows at Edgbaston

item.title: Sport picture of the day: long shadows at Edgbaston
item.trailText: As the sun goes down at Edgbaston, so does New Zealand’s hopes of getting a result against England in their first one-day international
item.standFirst: As the sun goes down at Edgbaston, so too does New Zealand’s hopes of getting a result against England in their first one-day international. After losing the toss, England made a record 408 for nine and their performance with the ball was just as impressive, bowling out the tourists for 198 to record a winning margin of 210

displayImages.altText: England's spin bowler Adil Rashid, right, successfully appeals for the wicket of New Zealand's batsman Matt Henry during the first ODI match between England and New Zealand

headerImage.caption: England’s spin bowler Adil Rashid, right, successfully appeals for the wicket of New Zealand’s batsman Matt Henry during the first one-day International match between England and New Zealand at Edgbaston. Photograph: Adrian Dennis/AFP/Getty Images
headerImage.altText: England's spin bowler Adil Rashid, right, successfully appeals for the wicket of New Zealand's batsman Matt Henry during the first one-day International match between England and New Zealand at Edgbaston.
headerImage.cleanCaption: England’s spin bowler Adil Rashid, right, successfully appeals for the wicket of New Zealand’s batsman Matt Henry during the first one-day International match between England and New Zealand at Edgbaston.

image.altText: England's spin bowler Adil Rashid, right, successfully appeals for the wicket of New Zealand's batsman Matt Henry during the first ODI match between England and New Zealand
